comments.commentBody:
So MSNBC has fallen prey to the right-wing corporate voices
who are trying to eliminate any intelligent critiques as an offset to the idiocy of the FOX nut-cases. Fellow listeners- wake up to
the dangers of censorship of the media!!\

I appreciate the reporting of the Times' Media Decoder on Keith's firing.

As I've commented before. my basic Comcast channel line-up no longer includes any C-span channel. Now, besides eviscerating MSNBC, they can just drop it from
the basic line-up. Does this have to happen before any of the Times' commentators (Gail, Tom, Frank) take note of Comcast's evident super-power?

Of course, you would still be able to go on Morning Joe to promote your books but many fewer people would be watching.

Thanks for listening.

I wonder what happened to the so called anti-monopoly law that Congress enacted for the purpose of keeping mega-conglomerates from controlling free enterprise and competition? Comcash, oops, I mean Comcast may be positioning the company for the nefarious whims of the Republican party i.e. monopolizing the airways and imposing right wing platitudes upon the population. Rupert Murdoch and his FOX network is already actively participating in right wing
propagandization of our previously non-partisan media markets. With the addition of NBC it's looking very bleak for the future of non-biased and subjective newscasts and other related network programming, such as MSNBC. I am wondering what Comcash is going to up to next? A couple of years ago I dropped their cable because of horrendous service and unreasonable prices.
Wouldn't it be great if a lot more people did? If Comcast isn't put on a tight leash there could be very serious consequences to free speech and freedom of the press, not to mention controlling the polictical process by buying off most of the right wing conservatives in Congress. These so called representatives of the people are notoriously susceptible to favors and money provided by big Wall
Street, big oil, foreign conglomerates and now, network media.

Whether Rex Ryan shoots off his mouth because it's part of his strategy or because he enjoys it or can't help himself, what makes it such a big story isn't about any real connection to what happens on the field because there is none.

There is an entire sports/entertainment industry that benefits from all this talk. The action on the field only occupies three hours of time whereas there is an entire week's worth of space to fill. The leagues, advertisers, media, agents, franchises, players all benefit from the attention. It creates villains to be hated (and loved, by non-conformists, rebels and renegades).

It is essential to create and reinforce the illusion that what these people have to say actually matters, as opposed to what they do. But all of this has almost nothing to do with what happens on the field. It is ridiculous to think that Tom Brady was affected by Rex Ryan's talk, or Mark Sanchez, or Rex Ryan himself. You are conflating the entertainment part of spectator sports with the actual competition on the field.

#27 - Michael S.Oak Park, IL

Please... When I was a young scholar, Democrats made it perfectly clear that my financial and career success was unimportant to them. I've seen the ugly side of the Democrat party face-to-face and I know that there are no solutions for our country coming from folks like you or the Obamas... As a small business owner, I'm surviving inspite of the government, not because of it.

Oh stuff it you negative pontiffs.   Is there anything, anything at all you all can find to say about  YOUR President?  He "laughingly" said.......Hello!    Can you please get a life or maybe not.   You feed off of hate.   Hope it fills you up.
What a disappointment. We were looking forward to President Obama doing some campaigning during an interview at halftime.

Obama isn't really from Chicago anyway. Only some people in the media, like reporters at the New York Times, believe he is. He's from Hawaii and went to Chicago via New York. I doubt he's ever been to a Bears game at Soldier Field, other than possibly for the purpose of trying to collect votes.
"He's calling himself the original Tea Partier." That sounds correct - an original BaggerBirtherBircherBigotBillionaire Partier. Get your hoods and robes out for the first Rally.

I'm glad I never had kids. But any parent who would let their children watch any of that reality stuff is pathetic. Is this what our society has come to, if you can make money on it its ok? And we want to blame our teachers for our childrens behavior.

@5 - Um, Ed from Arizona, George W. Bush spent nearly three times as many days away from work than President Obama during their first years.

http://www.factcheck.org...

Facts are so inconvenient sometimes.
It is respectfully hoped that the People of the Commonwealth of Virginia will not have slippery memories. Mr. Allen should be consigned to his "macaca" state of mind into perpetuities.

"In Congress, Republicans have included a ban on using federal funds for abortions in their efforts to dismantle Democrats’ health care overhaul."

Maybe Ms. Southhall should have mentioned that the healthcare law already restricts the use of federal funds on abortions?
Oh my! Mr. Macaca is baaaaack! People of Northern Virginia need to get out and campaign and vote against this man. Macaca indeed!
People always love power. Is George Allen power drunk? Typical tea party mindset! They think God has ordained them to rule their fellow men.
Folks complaining about the cost of protecting this FLOTUS are beyond sad. I'm sure you all were just as worried about the cost of protecting Laura Bush or Nancy Reagan.

@#1--

Consider the President fortunate. He won't have to endure the cultural wasteland of Arlington, Texas.

Yippee!!

The middle class has yet ANOTHER enemy running for office!!
Macaca would make a good mascot for the bigoted Tea Partiers.

I am going to cut spending on the military by rejecting unnecessary and useless weapons, and by ending the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan this summer. I am going to use the money saved to build infrastructure in America, thereby creating jobs. I am going to eliminate private contractors as fighters in foreign countries.
Putting aside the "macaca" remark, George Allen is a vicious man and a racist. This country does not need any more of his so-called service.

"Compared to past presidents that occupied the Oval office...president Obama has to be the most ever, to find any excuse to get away from his work as president. Not going to the Super Bowl will give him more time to think about the war in Afghanistan."

You have an incredibly short memory.
Shouldn't Scalia speak to ALL lawmakers? He is, after all, the justice of all of us. Equality for all under the law, right?
It's not Scalia's fault that some in Congress choose not to go.

It doesn't really matter whether President Obama attends the Super Bowl or not.  The important thing is the superior team won the game.  You Bears fans were only fooling yourself if you actually thought you had a realistic chance to win this game!  You guys were thoroughly out played and out coached!  Go Pack and see you in Dallas !!!!!!!!!!!!
